page.title: 03Epsom Common 1
page.content:
Epsom Common is perhaps best known as the site of The Wells, famous in the seventeenth century as the source of Epsom Salts. Houses now occupy the site of the old Wells but the common is maintained in its natural state, with only sufficient management to stop any deterioration of the habitat.
Epsom Common must have a lot of wildlife in the woodlands.There must be lots of birds for instance the Blue Tit,the Woodpecker,the Wren,the Blackbird,the Sparrow,the Magpie and the Thrush.
When we visited the common we saw thousands of baby frogs making their way across the paths near the Stew Pond. Many of these were killed by people walking along the paths.
